text: Watatsumi Shrine Affiliation Shinto Watatsumi Shrine (海神社) is a Shinto shrine in Kobe Japan founded by Empress Jingu upon her return from attempting to conquer Korea. It is dedicated to the god Watatsumi, who is associated with the sea and marine life. According to legend, Empress Jingū was nearly shipwrecked but managed to survive thanks to praying to Watatsumi, and she made the Akashi Shrine to honor him. At the same time, she also established Ikasuri Shrine and Ikuta Shrine. The shrine is often referred to as the in colloquial language, as it is a common misreading of the characters used in its name. == History == The shrine was first mentioned in 806 During the Edo period, it was considered highly significant to the rulers of the Akashi Domain who visited it every February The main Torii of the shrine was originally located on the beach, but due to land reclamation after World War II, it was moved further inland. == Related pages == * Kaijin Shrine which is sometimes also known as "Watatsumi Jinja" == References == Category:Beppyo shrines Category:Myōjin Taisha Category:Kanpei-chūsha Category:Kobe Category:Shinto shrines in Hyōgo Prefecture
title: Watatsumi Shrine
